[[module ListUsers users="."]]
++ Welcome, %%title%%.
[[/module]]
------
++ Introduction:
Welcome to Dr. Avenlee's Art-chives, a repository of SCP "draw-cuments" of utmost confidentiality, carefully curated by the esteemed Dr. Avenlee. Within these secure digital confines, you will find a collection of meticulously crafted artworks inspired by the Secure, Contain, Protect database. Each "draw-cument" encapsulates a plethora of concealed data, anomalies, and enigmas, awaiting your meticulous examination. Proceed with the utmost caution, as you embark on a journey into the classified realms of the unknown. We trust that your exploration will be both enlightening and rewarding.
------
++ Person of Interest:
[[/=]]

[[include component:image-block
| name=https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/art:dr-avenlee-s-artchives/Doctor%20Avenlee style="width: 35rem"
| caption=Photograph of Dr. Avenlee
| width=450px
| align=right]]

**Name:** Dr. Alexander ███████ Avenlee
@@@@
**Clearance level:** 3
@@@@
**Occupation:** Para-physicist, anartist
@@@@
**Formerly stationed sites:** Site-06T-9, Site-17, Site-19
@@@@
**Currently stationed at:** Site-999
@@@@
@@@@
**Incident Log-4/3/133-1:** On Date-██/██/20██, a group of Foundation personnel stumbled upon a collection of unusual documents hidden away in Dr. Avenlee's old office at site-06T-9. The documents were strange drawings, each one containing a detailed depiction of a paranormal entity or object.

At first, the personnel thought that the drawings were simply artistic creations, but upon closer examination, they realized that the images were more than just artistic renderings. The depicted objects and entites began to ████████ ██████████ ██████████████████ █████████████████████ ████████████████ ███████████████.

███████████████ ███████████████████████████████████████████████.

The artworks were scanned and their softcopies, which did not exhibit the anomalous properties, were meticulously archived for further analysis and reference. Nevertheless, due to the inherent anomalous nature of the original physical documents, they were subjected to controlled destruction protocols in accordance with Foundation regulations to prevent any unintended consequences or risks associated with their possession. Consequently, this page serves as a repository for all the archived draw-cuments, providing a record of these enigmatic and potentially significant findings for future research and containment purposes.




------

[[tab The Wanderers' Gallery]]

Dr. Avenlee received an email from an interdimensional art dealer who expressed a keen interest in acquiring a selection of his black and white paintings for a substantial financial consideration. Despite the dealer's reluctance to disclose the origins of the connection, there was a clear indication of fascination with Dr. Avenlee's artistic portfolio. Succumbing to the proposal, Dr. Avenlee agreed to dispatch the artworks under the stipulation that they would be employed in the development of a specialized interdimensional transportation device. This device purportedly held the capability to teleport the paintings to a specified destination.

The subsequent records delineate the series of experiments conducted by Dr. Avenlee in his attempts to achieve interdimensional teleportation of the designated artworks.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Experiment Log 1:**

**Subject:** Black and white painting-1

**Goal:** To teleport the painting to a designated location.

**Procedure:** The painting was placed on the teleportation device and the coordinates of a designated location were inputted. The device was activated and the painting was teleported.

**Result:** The designated location did not receive the painting. There was no sign of the painting anywhere in the surrounding area.

**Conclusion:** The teleportation process was successful, but the painting did not arrive at its intended destination.

**Experiment Log 2:**

**Subject:** Black and white painting-2

**Goal:** To teleport the painting to a different designated location

**Procedure:** The painting was placed on the teleportation device and new coordinates were inputted. The device was activated and the painting was teleported.

**Result:** The designated location did not receive the painting. There was no sign of the painting anywhere in the surrounding area.

**Conclusion:** The teleportation process was successful, but the painting did not arrive at its intended destination. Further investigation is required to determine where the painting has ended up.

**Experiment Log 3:**

**Subject:** Black and white painting-3

**Goal:** To determine the location of the painting that was teleported in previous experiments

**Procedure:** A GPS tracking device was attached to the painting before it was placed on the teleportation device. The same coordinates were inputted as in Experiment 2. The device was activated and the painting was teleported.

**Result:** The GPS tracking device lost signal.

**Conclusion:** The painting has somehow changed physical dimensions. Further investigation is required to determine how and why this happened.

**Experiment Log 4:**

**Subject:** Black and white painting-4

**Goal:** To determine the location of the painting that was teleported in previous experiments.

**Procedure:** a small camera was attached to one of the multiple black and white paintings before it was placed on the teleportation device, the same coordinates were inputted and the device was activated. The paintings were successfully teleported.

**Result:** Visual feed from the painting's camera shows a vast [https://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/the-wanderers-gallery "Gallery"].
[[/div]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Additional Documentation]]

The following is a list of additional files featuring Dr. Avenlee's work.

Documents recovered from the Wanderers Library: [https://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/the-strange-box Dr. Avenlee's Archives]

SCP-085 dancing animation:
[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:file-princess-cassandra Princess Cassandra: Visual Archives Contest Entry]

Archive containing classified information about sentient memetic kill agents:
[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:memetic-killagent-archive Memetic Kill Agent Archive]

A collection of more paintings but with poetry: [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:avenlee-s-artwoetry Avenlee's Artwoetry]

SCP Animation Archives: [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:scp-animation-archives SCP Animation Archives](Collaboration page)

Dum ol doodles posted on the SCiPnet as "Comics": [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:scip-comics SCiP Comics]

AWCY's attempt at accessing foundation database: [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/art:error66-r7-3-m155 Error66-@rt-E-Miss](Gone wrong for obvious reasons.)

Dr. Avenlee was once obsessed with the concept of "Liminal spaces". Probably still is... here's an interesting page: [http://backrooms-wiki.wikidot.com/dr-avenlee "THE VOID"]
